title: Takeaways: Why the Knicks got pummeled by the Pacers in Game 6
content: Here's what has stood out from the latest playoff games of the Eastern and Western Conference finals.

title: Pacers race past Knicks to punch Finals ticket
content: Pascal Siakam earned Eastern Conference MVP honors after leading the Pacers to a Game 6 victory over the Knicks to set up a date with OKC in the Finals.

title: PSG rout Inter in record UCL final win for 1st title
content: Paris Saint-Germain won their first Champions League title with a 5-0 demolition of Inter Milan -- the biggest winning margin in the final of the competition.

title: Fans honor PSG coach's late daughter after win
content: PSG fans paid homage to Luis Enrique's late daughter with an emotive tifo, while the Spaniard wore a T-shirt depicting them planting a club flag together.

title: Horns clear OU 'hurdle,' seal spot in WCWS semis
content: Texas defeated rival and four-time defending national champion Oklahoma 4-2 in the Women's College World Series on Saturday, improving the Longhorns' record this season to 53-11 and punching their ticket to the semifinals Monday in Oklahoma City.

title: Trans athlete wins H.S. high jump title in Calif.
content: Transgender athlete AB Hernandez was co-champion in the girls' high jump at the California high school track and field championship Saturday and placed second in the long jump.

title: Thunder -750 favorites in NBA Finals over Pacers
content: Oklahoma City is one of the biggest betting favorites in an NBA Finals across the past 20 seasons, with the West champion Thunder opening as -750 favorites over the Pacers at ESPN BET on Saturday night, and the return price for Indiana was set at +525.

title: Flawless Scheffler surges into lead at Memorial
content: Scottie Scheffler was at his best on a tough day at Muirfield Village, opening with 13 straight pars and then pouring it on at the end for a 4-under 68 that gave him a one-shot lead Saturday over Ben Griffin at the Memorial.

title: Dodgers place netting after falling concrete hits fan
content: The Dodgers put up protective netting at Dodger Stadium after a chunk of concrete struck a fan from above during Friday night's game against the Yankees.

title: üèà CFP format debate: What we've learned
content: The debate about the future format of the CFP is raging. Particularly, how it hurts or helps the biggest leagues.

title: PSG win first Champions League by utterly humiliating Inter Milan
content: Led by 19-year-old D√©sir√© Dou√©, a young PSG side embarrassed an experienced Inter Milan in the UEFA Champions League final.

title: How Freddie Freeman's World Series grand slam changed him -- and Dodgers fans -- forever
content: There are bobbleheads, T-shirts, tattoos -- and even one fan, according to Freeman, who said he hadn't touched a drink since.

title: Emma Hayes has found her USWNT 'Triple Espresso' alternatives
content: Michelle Cooper and Alyssa Thompson were electric on Saturday, offering Emma Hayes even more options as she plots the USWNT's path to 2027 World Cup glory.

title: The Americans still playing at the 2025 French Open
content: American star Coco Gauff and newcomer Hailey Baptiste are still in the draw at the French Open -- but who else is? We break it down.

title: Is Shedeur Sanders set up to win QB battle in Browns' new-look offense?
content: The Browns have a lot of new faces on offense, including at coordinator and under center, as they reshape the unit.

title: Verstappen on battling McLarens: My time to shine
content: Max Verstappen joked that he will try to put on a show for the cameras in Turn 1 against the dominant McLarens.

title: Antony says farewell to Betis: 'Felt like home'
content: Antony has thanked Real Betis for helping to "find a piece" of himself as he comes to the end of a six-month loan spell that sees him return to Manchester United.

title: Madrid edge United as world's most valuable club
content: LaLiga side Real Madrid topped the list of the most valuable football teams in the world for the fourth year in a row with a valuation of $6.75 billion.

title: Heitinga leaves Liverpool to take over at Ajax
content: Ajax have hired John Heitinga as their new manager, with the Liverpool assistant replacing Francesco Farioli.

title: Gasperini confirms Atalanta exit amid Roma links
content: Manager Gian Piero Gasperini confirmed his departure from Serie A side Atalanta with an emotional message to supporters on Saturday.

title: LAFC chases 'massive' $9.5M Club World Cup spot
content: LAFC will host Club Am√©rica in a high-stakes play-in match on Saturday night for the final spot in the expanded FIFA Club World Cup.

title: Source: Liverpool bid club-record $147M for Wirtz
content: Liverpool have submitted a club-record ‚Ç¨130 million bid to sign Bayer Leverkusen playmaker Florian Wirtz this summer, a source has told ESPN.

title: Mexico confirms co-hosting 2031 WWC with U.S.
content: Mexico confirmed it will co-host the 2031 Women's World Cup with the United States in FIFA's first expanded 48-team tournament.

title: San Diego FC to ban 33 fans over postgame brawl
content: San Diego FC announced 33 individuals will be banned indefinitely from attending all club and MLS matches after a violent clash between supporters following a match against the LA Galaxy.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Saudi Pro League eyes move for Messi
content: The Saudi Public Investment Fund has reportedly opened talks with Lionel Messi. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Transfer window preview: What do Europe's big clubs need?
content: The first transfer window is set to open across Europe on June 1, so what are the top clubs planning?

title: Panthers-Oilers II: Key stats to know for the 2025 Stanley Cup Final
content: For the second consecutive season, it's Florida-Edmonton. Here's what you need to know before Game 1.

title: Something about this OKC team looks familiar ‚Äî and the NBA should be terrified
content: The Thunder have followed in the footsteps of the 2014-15 Golden State Warriors this season. Is a future dynasty in the making?

title: Updated NBA draft rankings: How the NCAA withdrawal deadline shook up the top 100
content: With 18 of our top 100 NBA prospects returning to college, there's movement in our list, starting at No. 5.

title: NBA draft withdrawal deadline: NIL's impact, Florida's gain, the 2026 draft, more
content: Who are biggest winners and losers from prospects' decisions to stay or go? We answer the burning questions.

title: Conference USA preview: Liberty is early favorite but contenders abound
content: The Flames are the team to beat, but Western Kentucky and Jacksonville State (among others) can't be counted out.

title: Why the Maple Leafs shouldn't re-sign Mitch Marner -- and what they should do instead
content: Toronto has some franchise-altering decisions to make this summer, starting with the perennial All-Star.

title: 32 dead as floods, landslides devastate northeast in early monsoon season
content: Heavy rains triggered by a depression over Bangladesh and Meghalaya have caused widespread devastation across five northeastern states, resulting in at least 32 deaths due to landslides and floods. Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Mizoram, and Arunachal Pradesh are the most affected, with houses collapsing, villages inundated, and transportation disrupted.

title: 'Dear mom & dad ... ': Tej Pratap pleads for love, blames ‚Äògreedy people‚Äô for rift with family
content: Following his expulsion from the RJD and estrangement from his father, Lalu Prasad Yadav, Tej Pratap Yadav has publicly appealed to his parents for their love and trust, blaming political conspiracies for his downfall. Lalu expelled Tej Pratap for allegedly violating moral values and harming the family's principles after a controversial social media post.

title: India lost jets but changed tactics to hit Pakistan hard: CDS
content: CDS General Anil Chauhan acknowledged India's initial fighter jet losses during Operation Sindoor against terror hubs in Pakistan and PoK on May 7. He refuted Pakistan's claims of shooting down six IAF aircraft, including Rafales. India adapted its tactics, inflicting significant damage on Pakistani airbases deep inside the border before a ceasefire was established.

title: 'He is a Sinwar too': Israel military claims Hamas chief killed in May 13 strike
content: An Israeli airstrike on May 13 targeted and killed Muhammad Sinwar, a senior Hamas figure, while he was operating in a tunnel beneath the European Hospital in Khan Younis. The strike also eliminated Muhammad Shabana and Mahdi Quara, commanders within Hamas's ranks. When Yahya Sinwar was killed in combat in October 2024, Muhammad Sinwar became the leader of Hamas in the Gaza Strip.

title: IPL 2025 Qualifier 2: Punjab Kings likely to get Yuzvendra Chahal boost
content: Punjab Kings bowler Yuzvendra Chahal, who is nursing a wrist injury, and Mumbai Indians' seamer Deepak Chahar, who didn't play the Eliminator against Gujarat Titans due to a hamstring niggle, are likely to play for their respective teams in Qualifier 2 at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad.

title: Microsoft exec has a message for coders, after it laid off over 2k software engineers
content: Despite recent layoffs impacting software engineers, Microsoft's CPO, Aparna Chennapragada, defends the importance of computer science education. She argues AI is simply another layer of abstraction, transforming roles into "software operators" rather than eliminating them. As Microsoft invests heavily in AI, project managers will also adapt, focusing on editing and refining AI-generated ideas.

title: 7 killed, 30 injured as passenger train derails after bridge collapse in Russia
content: A passenger train derailed in Russia's Bryansk region after a bridge collapsed, resulting in at least seven fatalities and 30 injuries. Russian authorities attribute the incident to "illegal interference," citing damage to the bridge above the railway line. The collapse sent debris onto the tracks, impacting the oncoming train, with emergency services responding to the scene.

title: 'I am not taking drugs!': Musk refutes claims of drug abuse during 2024 campaign trail
content: Elon Musk refuted claims of extensive drug use, including ketamine, during the 2024 Presidential campaign, labeling a New York Times report as false. He admitted to a past prescription for ketamine to combat mental health issues but stated he hasn't used it recently. The report alleged Musk's drug use led to health problems and cited erratic behavior.

title: 'Make Elon Musk work 40-plus hours....': Tesla's biggest shareholders to board
content: Major Tesla shareholders, including pension funds and state treasurers, have issued an urgent demand to board chair Robyn Denholm, addressing a perceived crisis. They are pushing for a 40-hour work week commitment from Elon Musk, CEO succession planning, limits on directors' external roles, and the appointment of independent board members.

title: He robbed truck driver in Bengaluru, but didn‚Äôt know his punches killed victim
content: Bengaluru police solved the mystery of Gangadharaiah's death, initially deemed unnatural. An autopsy revealed fractured ribs, leading to a murder investigation. The break came when the victim's stolen mobile phone was activated in Salem, Tamil Nadu. Police traced it to Naresh Kumar Raja, a wanted criminal, who confessed to attacking and robbing Gangadharaiah, resulting in his death.

title: After Gill, Pandya also shuts down rumours of rift between the two
content: Shubman Gill and Hardik Pandya have dismissed rumours of a rift following Gujarat Titans' IPL 2025 elimination, addressing speculation fuelled by on-field interactions and Pandya's move to Mumbai Indians. Both players affirmed their camaraderie on social media after Mumbai Indians' victory in the Eliminator match. Mumbai Indians will play IPL Qualifier 2 against Punjab Kings today.

title: 73 casualties recorded during 1st month of Char Dham yatra
content: The Char Dham yatra has seen 65 pilgrim deaths due to health issues, primarily cardiac-related, and eight fatalities from accidents. Kedarnath reported the highest number of deaths, followed by Badrinath, Yamunotri, and Gangotri. Health screenings identified thousands of pilgrims with comorbidities, with many receiving counseling or medical referrals due to the challenges posed by high altitudes and extreme weather conditions.

title: WhatsApp will not work on these after May 31, check list
content: Starting June 1, 2025, WhatsApp will discontinue support for older iPhones lacking iOS 15.1 and Android devices below version 5.1. This update, delayed from May 5th, aims to enhance security and performance by leveraging newer OS features. Affected users are advised to upgrade their devices, explore alternative messaging apps, or back up their chats to avoid service disruptions.

title: Spicejet fliers forced to sit in aircraft for 3 hours in Delhi
content: SpiceJet's Delhi-Pune flight SG-477, carrying approximately 150 passengers, reached its destination nearly four hours late on Friday. The flight, initially scheduled for a 3:25 pm departure, faced delays due to a last-minute technical issue. Passengers were kept waiting inside the aircraft for around three hours, causing frustration.

title: 21 athletes killed in Nigeria road crash
content: A bus crash on a Nigerian highway on Saturday killed 21 athletes returning from a national sports tournament, with authorities saying the accident might have been the result of driver fatigue or excessive speed. The Federal Road Safety Corps (FRSC) said the afternoon crash, which did not involve other vehicles, "might have occurred as a result of fatigue and excessive speed" after a long overnight trip.

title: Spent 15% of time nixing fake news during Op Sindoor: CDS
content: CDS Gen Anil Chauhan highlighted that India spent 15% of Operation Sindoor's time countering disinformation during the four-day conflict with Pakistan, which he termed a "non-contact and multi-domain" war. India maintained operational clarity and autonomy, detecting no unusual Chinese activity along the LAC. The nation relied on indigenous systems and drew a new redline against Pakistani terrorism, emphasizing fact-based communication.

title: Government mulls doubling safeguard duty on steel from 12% to 24%
content: The Indian government is considering raising the safeguard duty on steel to 24% from the existing 12% due to concerns about potential circumvention by Chinese companies and the impact on domestic steelmakers. This move comes amid fears of trade diversion as Chinese goods face increased levies in other markets, potentially leading to dumping in India.

title: 5 signs of increased uric acid seen in body - 3 simple steps to fix it
content: High uric acid, a common concern due to modern lifestyles, can lead to gout and kidney stones. The body signals its presence through joint pain, stiffness, fatigue, and changes in urine. Small, painless lumps under the skin may also appear.

title: Lord Jagannath‚Äôs Kolkata chariot to glide on Sukhoi tyres
content: Kolkata's Iskcon Rath Yatra chariot, carrying Lord Jagannath, will roll on new Sukhoi fighter jet tyres, replacing the old Boeing 747 tyres. This change comes after a steering snag last year and a two-decade search for suitable replacements. The MRF-manufactured tyres will enhance manoeuvrability, safety, and stability, especially on Kolkata's tram-tracked roads, ensuring a smoother Yatra experience.

title: Hoping to put Pak on grey list, India eyes FATF tango with US
content: Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri's US visit focused on strengthening economic and financial ties, including FATF coordination, crucial for India's efforts to address terror financing. Discussions also covered defense partnership enhancement through co-production, joint exercises, and information sharing. Both nations reviewed trade agreements, technology cooperation, and streamlining export regulations to bolster the bilateral agenda.

title: 'Bhool Chuk Maaf': Rajkummar Rao, Wamiqa Gabbi‚Äôs starrer earns over Rs 5cr on day 9
content: Rajkummar Rao and Wamiqa Gabbi's 'Bhool Chuk Maaf' is a box office success after its theatrical release on May 23, 2025. The film earned ‚Çπ5.15 crore on its second Saturday, bringing the total to ‚Çπ52.50 crore. Despite mixed reviews, audiences are enjoying the time-loop romantic drama set in Banaras, which follows Ranjan's quest for love and a government job.

title: Madras high court stays suspension of student over 'Free Palestine' graffiti
content: Madras High Court has put a hold on the suspension of a Rajiv Gandhi National Institute of Youth Development student who was penalized for painting 'Jai Bhim' and 'Free Palestine' graffiti in his hostel room. Justice T V Thamilselvi instructed the institute to allow the student, S Aslam, to attend exams and participate in the internship program.

title: She died in my arms: Poonch mourns lives lost in Pak shelling
content: In May, relentless shelling in Poonch near the LoC claimed 14 civilian lives and wounded over 65, leaving a trail of devastation and fear. Homes were destroyed, families displaced, and a seminary was attacked, resulting in casualties and false accusations against a religious teacher. While authorities offered support, the community grapples with loss, trauma, and lasting scars.

title: Active Covid cases cross 3,000 mark, Kerala tops list
content: India's active Covid-19 cases have surpassed 3,000, with Kerala reporting the highest number. Recent data indicates a rise in cases over the past ten days, accompanied by a few deaths. Health officials are closely monitoring the situation, emphasizing that the infections appear mild and are primarily being managed at home, with genome sequencing identifying Omicron sub-variants as the cause.

title: M K Stalin visits estranged brother Alagiri in Madurai
content: Tamil Nadu CM M K Stalin visited his elder brother M K Alagiri at his Madurai residence on Saturday night, marking a significant reunion after years of estrangement. The visit, prompted by Alagiri's invitation, occurred after Stalin's roadshow in the city. This is the second time Stalin is meeting Alagiri in a long time, previously meeting in Vellore in 2024.

title: ‚ÄòGrandpa, come home‚Äô: Granddaughter of top Maoist commander Devji makes appeal
content: Following the death of Maoist commander Basavaraju, Devji's granddaughter, Itlu Suma Tipiri, has made an emotional appeal for him to surrender. In a video message, Suma urges her grandfather, a potential successor to Basavaraju, to return home. She questions the state's anti-Maoist operations while expressing the family's longing for his return.

title: Jasmin Bhasin reveals she designed their home exactly as Aly Goni's dream
content: Aly Goni and Jasmin Bhasin have moved into their new home, a decision celebrated by their fans. Aly shared his reaction to Jasmin's interior design choices in a vlog, showcasing their home's features, including separate kitchens for vegetarian and non-vegetarian guests.

title: Delhi HC upholds Army officer‚Äôs termination for refusing to attend religious parade
content: The Delhi High Court upheld the 2017 termination of an Army officer who refused to participate in regimental religious parades due to his Christian faith. The court emphasized that the armed forces are united by their uniform, not divided by religion, and the officer's behavior was against the secular norms of the Army.

title: Elderly couple misses train, wins refund after 3-year battle in court
content: A senior citizen couple successfully sued South Western Railway after being denied a refund for a train journey they couldn't undertake due to severe overcrowding. The consumer commission ruled in their favor, citing deficiency in service, and ordered a full refund along with compensation for mental agony and litigation costs.

title: Surrendered Maoist dies by suicide in Hazaribag jail
content: A surrendered Maoist, Chhota Shyamlal Dehri, who was incarcerated in Hazaribag jail since 2021, allegedly committed suicide in his cell on Saturday. He used a rope and wire to hang himself from the ceiling fan. Jail authorities discovered the incident during the morning count, raising questions about how he obtained the rope.

title: Disproportionate response to terror is norm now: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Modi, addressing a women's empowerment rally in Bhopal, declared a new norm of disproportionate response to terrorist attacks, stating India will retaliate with greater force. He emphasized that the terrorists' challenge to India's 'nari shakti' in Pahalgam led to their destruction. Modi highlighted Operation Sindoor as a successful anti-terror operation, showcasing India's strength.

title: Crack down on Pak spy network: NIA raids 15 locations over leak of classified info
content: The NIA conducted searches across 15 locations in 8 states, investigating a CRPF personnel, Moti Ram Jat, accused of sharing classified information with Pakistani intelligence officers. Jat, now dismissed and in custody, allegedly leaked sensitive data since 2023 in exchange for funds.

title: Pakistan violated Indus Water Treaty through terror: India
content: India has accused Pakistan of violating the Indus Waters Treaty (IWT) due to persistent cross-border terrorism. At a conference in Tajikistan, Kirti Vardhan Singh condemned Pakistan's attempt to misuse the forum by raising IWT issues. Singh highlighted the need to reassess the treaty due to changed circumstances like technological advancements and climate change.

title: 'Fog of war lifting': Kharge attacks Modi govt after remarks by CDS on Op Sindoor
content: Mallikarjun Kharge, the Congress president, criticized the Modi government. This followed CDS General Anil Chauhan's statements in Singapore. Kharge demanded a special Parliament session. He alleged the nation was misled. Chauhan dismissed Pakistan's claims about downed Indian warplanes. He spoke about Operation Sindoor. Jairam Ramesh echoed Kharge's concerns. He criticized the government's lack of transparency regarding the matter.

title: After warning on China threat, US bats for stronger military ties with India
content: US Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth, at the Shangri-La Dialogue, emphasized deepening security ties with India and advocated for expanded QUAD cooperation to counter China's assertiveness. He highlighted initiatives like the Indo-Pacific Logistics Network and the Partnership for Indo-Pacific Industrial Resilience (PIPER) to bolster regional defence capabilities and supply chains.

title: Haines-Holden stand lifts England Lions after Karun Nair‚Äôs double ton
content: Karun Nair's double century propelled India A to a formidable 557 against England Lions in their unofficial Test. In response, the Lions displayed resilience, reaching 237 for 2 at stumps on Day 2. Tom Haines led the charge with an unbeaten 103, supported by Max Holden's fluent 64, setting up an intriguing Day 3.

title: After Tharoor row, Khurshid's take on Art 370 fresh headache for Congress
content: Salman Khurshid's recent remarks backing the nullification of Article 370 have stirred unease within the Congress party, especially after Shashi Tharoor's comments on surgical strikes. Khurshid, part of an all-party delegation, defended the abrogation in Indonesia, highlighting the subsequent elections and perceived prosperity in Jammu & Kashmir.

title: Gorakhpur poultry shops shut for 21 days after bird flu cases
content: In Gorakhpur, Uttar Pradesh, all poultry shops are closed for 21 days after avian influenza strains H5N1 and H9N2 were detected in bird samples from five city localities. Following confirmation from NIHSAD Bhopal, culling operations began within a 1km radius of infected zones.

title: Bombay HC holds businessman‚Äôs arrest in Rs 67 cr case illegal, orders his release
content: The Bombay High Court declared Hemang Shah's arrest illegal due to the police's failure to produce him before a magistrate within 24 hours. Justices Gauri Godse and Somasekhar Sundaresan ordered his immediate release from Arthur Road Jail, citing a violation of Article 22(2) of the Constitution.

title: 3 of family killed in jumbo attack
content: In a tragic incident in Bengal's Alipurduar, three members of a family, including a 35-day-old infant, lost their lives in an elephant attack. A herd of 20 elephants entered Kunjanagar village, and a stray tusker trampled Manoj Das to death. His mother, Makhanrani, and infant daughter, Manisha, were also killed in the attack as she rushed to help.

title: 2-year jail for Mukhtar's MLA son; he faces disqualification
content: UP MLA Abbas Ansari, son of the late Mukhtar Ansari, received a two-year prison sentence in a 2022 hate speech case, potentially leading to his disqualification as a legislator. The sentencing stems from threats he made against government officials during the assembly poll campaign. While granted temporary bail to appeal, the conviction jeopardizes his position under the law.

title: Why age gap romance still rules Indian cinema: Vivek Agnihotri & others discuss
content: In the world of Indian cinema‚Äîwhere fantasy meets formula‚Äîfew tropes have persisted as stubbornly as the tendency to pair aging male superstars with much younger female leads. What was once accepted without question is now being challenged more vocally‚Äîby audiences, actors, and filmmakers alike. In this special feature, ETimes gathers unfiltered insights from industry insiders like Govind Namdev, Shenaz Treasury, Vivek Agnihotri, Anant Mahadevan, Rahul Bhat who lay bare the gendered dynamics of Indian cinema‚Äôs most controversial romantic formula.

title: Punjab & Haryana high court upholds dismissal of former Haryana judicial officer
content: The Punjab and Haryana High Court has ruled that "deemed confirmation" cannot supersede an employer's right to assess a probationer's suitability. Dismissing a petition by former judicial officer Ankur Lal, the court emphasized that automatic confirmation undermines the ability to evaluate work, conduct, and integrity.

title: Stephen Curry enjoys beach vacation with Ayesha after Warriors‚Äô playoff exit
content: Following the Golden State Warriors' playoff exit, Stephen Curry and his wife, Ayesha, are enjoying a relaxing beach vacation. They shared intimate moments on social media, highlighting their strong bond. Beyond their getaway, they've been spotted at events like BottleRock, balancing personal time with entrepreneurial ventures as Stephen prepares for the upcoming NBA season.

title: Hindu bloc repeats Ajmer Dargah claim
content: Vishnu Gupta, the Hindu Sena national president, has urged an Ajmer court to dismiss responses from the dargah committee and ASI denying the existence of a Shiva temple beneath the Khwaja Moinuddin Chisti dargah. Gupta, in his rejoinder, reaffirmed his claim and right to worship at the site, dismissing the respondents' replies as obstructing justice.

title: Ekambaram, among last women leaders in banking, to retire
content: Shanti Ekambaram, Kotak Mahindra Bank's Deputy MD, will retire in October 2025 after three decades. Her departure follows Uday Kotak's exit and other senior leaders, including KVS Manian. Paritosh Kashyap is appointed as whole-time director, pending approval. Ekambaram's exit adds to the list of senior leaders who have exited since Uday Kotak's early retirement.

title: 'Want my captain back': Bruins fans divided as Marchand leads Panthers to finals
content: Former Boston Bruins captain Brad Marchand's trade to the Florida Panthers has sparked mixed reactions among Bruins fans, despite the Panthers reaching the 2025 Stanley Cup Finals. While some fans criticize the Bruins' management for letting Marchand go, others believe it was a mutually beneficial decision, allowing him a shot at the Cup.

title: EA Sports College Football 26 gameplay officially revealed in new trailer
content: college football 26 will include thousands of real college players and over 300 real-world coaches . the game also has added over 2700 new plays, which EA Sports says will make for "authentic college football like never before" the series started in 1993 with the release of Bill Walsh College Football on the Sega Genesis .

title: Champions League final: PSG hammer Inter Milan 5-0 to win first-ever title
content: the TOI Sports Desk excels in a myriad of roles that capture the essence of live sporting events and deliver compelling content to readers worldwide . from running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents . the desk is adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary .

title: F1 25 review -- A familiar package with a shining, compelling story mode
content: the introduction of the Braking Point story mode into the series has been interesting to watch . fans of the series scorned it for using up resources that could've gone into the more traditional modes . it's a trend that EA Sports F1 25 will likely continue .

title: Manny Pacquiao is back, but why is he getting a title shot?
content: Manny Pacquiao returns to the ring for the first time in almost four years . the 46-year-old is boxing's only eight-division champion . he last fought in august 2021 when he suffered a loss by unanimous decision to Yordenis Ugas .

title: Cowboys' Dak Prescott and fianc√©e Sarah Jane Ramos welcome new daughter
content: dak Prescott's fianc√©e, Sarah Jane Ramos, gave birth to a baby girl on may 22 . the couple named their daughter Aurora Rayne . "i love you [Sarah Jane] and the family we've created," Prescott wrote .

title: Free agency and draft plans for Stars, Hurricanes, every other eliminated team
content: the 2024-25 NHL regular season is over and the playoffs are underway . a breakdown of the biggest keys this offseason and realistic expectations for next season . more teams will be added to this story as they are eliminated .

title: "Putting Blame On...": India Slams Shehbaz Sharif For Indus Waters Treaty Remark
content: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif had said his country would not allow India to cross the red line by holding the Indus Waters Treaty in abeyance.

title: Russia "Immediate" Danger, China "Sophisticated" Challenge: Key UK Report
content: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer's government is set to publish the strategic defence review -- a 10-year plan for military equipment and services -- on Monday.

title: "Totally Unacceptable": US Envoy On Hamas' Answer To Truce Proposal In Gaza
content: The key differences between the US proposal and Hamas's response appeared to be the duration of any truce and the extent to which Israeli forces withdraw.

title: Key Road Linking Assam And Meghalaya Washed Away In Northeast Rain Fury
content: National Highway 17 (NH-17), a link between Tura in Meghalaya and Guwahati in Assam has suffered damage, cutting off road connectivity.

title: "Tried Prescription Ketamine": Elon Musk On Drug Abuse Charge In Report
content: The New York Times reported Friday that the billionaire adviser to President Donald Trump used so much ketamine, a powerful anesthetic, that he developed bladder problems.

title: 7 Killed, 30 Hospitalised After Bridge Collapse, Train Derail In Russia
content: At least seven people were killed and 30 hospitalised after "illegal interference" caused a bridge to collapse and a train to derail in Russia's Bryansk region that borders Ukraine, Russian authorities said early on Sunday.

title: 30 Dead In 2 Days In Northeast After Flash Floods, Heavy Rain, Landslides
content: At least 30 people have died in the northeast in the last two days following landslides and flash floods. Today, fourteen people have died across the region in landslides and flash floods.

title: 71 Killed Due To Excessive Pre-Monsoon Rains In Karnataka
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's office on Saturday said that 71 people lost their lives due to excessive pre-monsoon showers in the state since April.

title: India On Track To Eradicating Maoism By Next Year? What The Numbers Show
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has repeatedly said that the government is committed to eradicating Maoism from India by March 2026, and the goal got a fillip when at least 27 Maoists were killed in an encounter in Chhattisgarh earlier this month.

title: Himachal's 'Return Your Trash' Scheme As Mountains Drown In Garbage
content: Plastic bags and bottles strewn everywhere, animals scavenging on dumped solid waste - the disturbing scene is not from a dumpsite but from a forest in Himachal Pradesh's Kasol.

title: 7 Ajit Pawar MLAs In Nagaland Join Ruling Party, Give Neiphiu Rio Absolute Majority
content: All seven NCP MLAs in Nagaland joined the ruling NDPP on Saturday, giving the CM Neiphiu Rio-led party an absolute majority in the 60-member assembly.

title: "Fog Of War Is Clearing": Mallikarjun Kharge Targets Centre Over Chief of Defence Staff General Anil Chauhan's Remark
content: Mallikarjun Kharge on Saturday demanded the government to hold a special session of Parliament immediately, following Chief of Defence Staff General Anil Chauhan's acknowledgement of aircraft loss in the hostilities.

title: Rajeev Krishna To Be New Director General Of Police Of Uttar Pradesh
content: Senior Indian Police Service officer Rajeev Krishna will be the new Director General of Police (DGP) of Uttar Pradesh, officials said on Saturday.

title: Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla To Serve As Mission Pilot On Axiom-4 Mission: Jitendra Singh
content: Union Minister for Department of Space, Jitendra Singh announced on Saturday that Shubhanshu Shukla, one of India's astronauts, will conduct exclusive food and nutrition-related experiments onboard the International Space Station (ISS).

title: "Operation Shield": Mock Drills Conducted In 6 States, Union Territories
content: The authorities in Punjab, Haryana and Chandigarh on Saturday conducted a major statewide civil defence exercise named "Operation Shield" to enhance emergency preparedness and response capabilities.

title: Miss Thailand Opal Suchata Crowned Miss World 2025 In Hyderabad
content: In a dazzling culmination of grace, beauty, and strength, Thailand's Opal Suchata was crowned Miss World 2025 in a star-studded ceremony in Hyderabad, Telangana.

title: Hamas Responds To US Proposal, Agrees To Free 10 Living Hostages
content: Hamas said on Saturday it had responded to a ceasefire proposal presented by US President Donald Trump's Middle East envoy, Steve Witkoff, to mediators and included a demand for an end to the war, which had previously been a red line for Israel.

title: Cops Say Influencer's Arrest Over Communal Post Lawful, BJP Slams Trinamool
content: Dimissing claims that an Instagram influencer, who uploaded a video with alleged communal comments in reference to Operation Sindoor was arrested unlawfully, the Kolkata Police has said several attempts were made to serve notice to her.

title: 'The Royals' On Netflix Sparks Royal Rumble Over "Stereotypes, Narratives"
content: Certain storylines on 'The Royals' on Netflix have sparked a furore among some of India's erstwhile royal families.

title: Brother Of Man Who Supplied SIM Cards To Pak Operatives Arrested In Delhi
content: Delhi Police has arrested another accused in connection with an ongoing investigation into an espionage racket linked to Pakistani intelligence operatives (PIOs), an official said on Saturday.

title: Stanley Cup Final odds: McDavid is Conn Smythe fave in Panthers rematch
content: the Edmonton Oilers beat the Florida Panthers 3-0 in the last year's Stanley Cup final . Connor McDavid and the Oilers won the next three to force a Game 7 . the oilers defeated their in-state rivals, the Tampa Bay Lightning in the first round, the Toronto Maple Leafs in a seven-game second round .

title: 2026 recruiting class rankings: Notre Dame pushes closer to the top spot
content: Notre Dame has pushed its way into the no. 2 slot of our 2026 class rankings . the Fighting Illini shook off the loss of ESPN 300 CB Victor Singleton quite well . Nasir Rankin , a top-10 athlete in the ESPN 300, is an early in-state priority .

title: 71 killed due to excessive pre-monsoon rains in Karnataka since April
content: The State normally receives 74 mm of rainfall in May, but the actual rainfall was 219 mm, which is 197% higher than the average normal rainfall

title: Nearly 1,500 tourists stranded in north Sikkim as rains continue, search for missing 8 suspended
content: Mangan's SP Sonam Detchu Bhutia said 115 tourists are stranded in Lachen and 1,350 tourists in Lachung

title: Instagram influencer Sharmishta Panoli arrested for communal post, sent to 14 days judicial custody
content: According to the Kolkata Police, several attempts were made to serve legal notices to Ms. Panoli and her family, but the attempts were unsuccessful because Ms. Panoli and her family absconded

title: Union Minister Somanna inspects redevelopment works at Bidar railway station
content: The project, which is being implemented at an estimated cost of ‚Çπ24.35 crore, aims to transform the station with modern amenities and improved infrastructure

title: Naidu has corrupted all systems in A.P., alleges Sajjala
content: Cases are being filed against the opposition leaders without any evidence, alleges Ramakrishna Reddy

title: Awareness programmes mark ‚ÄòWorld No Tobacco Day‚Äô
content: The Collector administered a pledge against using tobacco to participants and asked the youth to enlighten the people on the ill-effects of using tobacco products

title: TTD official warns against circulating ‚Äòmisleading‚Äô video clips on social media
content: The warning comes after a video clip about devotees waiting in darshan queue lines allegedly growing restive went viral on social media

title: Tardy progress of Budameru works causes concern
content: Officials say that the contractor could not mobilise sufficient machinery and workforce in time; WRD Minister asks officials to issue notice to contracting agency   ¬†¬†

title: TDP used Mahanadu to target YSRCP leaders, alleges MLC Botcha Satyanarayana
content: Satyanarayana calls Mahanadu event a drama, says the event aimed at diverting attention from the ‚Äòfailures of the NDA government‚Äô

title: SIT questions accused in liquor scam for second day
content: The investigating officers took the accused into custody from the Vijayawada jail and and questioned them for the second day

title: TTD initiates trial of anti-drone surveillance system at Tirumala
content: The aim is to enhance aerial security and prevent unauthorised drone activity in the airspace of the temple town¬†

title: 89% schools and 87% colleges declared tobacco-free: DPH
content: Director of Public Health said that Tamil Nadu has implemented comprehensive interventions focussed on enforcement, awareness, capacity building, cessation services and safeguarding institutions from tobacco exposure

title: Ride easy: reimagining Chennai‚Äôs future rail networks
content: For nearly three decades, very few improvements were made to the primary urban-suburban rail network of Chennai. Although the MRTS and Metro Rail were introduced, the Metro has become more popular due to its superior services. Now, it seems that for the first time, there appears to be a focused effort to improve rail services in Chennai. Along with enhancements to the Metro, will the city have an enviable rail service in a decade?

title: How do military standoffs affect aviation? | Explained
content: What are the situations in which countries can close their airspace? Are only military planes banned? What happens to civilian flights? After Operation Sindoor, are Indian planes now being allowed in Pakistan and vice-versa?

title: Punjab Police report disrupted drug supply chain, prices surge amid ongoing anti-drug drive
content: DGP Gaurav Yadav announces intensified crackdown with fresh action plans, while Congress challenges AAP‚Äôs ‚Äòdrug-free Punjab‚Äô deadline

title: Why is the RBI changing gold loan rules? | Explained
content: What are the draft proposals? What has the Ministry of Finance clarified? What will be the impact on borrowers?

title: BJP MLAs, farmers, seers stage protest opposing Hemavathi Express Link Canal Project in Tumakuru
content: Tumakuru MP and Union Minister of State for Jal Shakti V Somanna writes to CM opposing the project to supply water to from Tumakuru to Bengaluru South district

title: Amid opposition, GCC advances Solid Waste Processing Facility project at Kodungaiyur
content: The civic body has initiated the process to appoint an independent engineer (IE) to supervise the implementation of the project

title: ¬†Nurse booked for accidentally chopping off tip of newborn‚Äôs thumb at Vellore hospital
content: The nurse was removing paediatric venflon from the baby‚Äôs hand when she mistakenly cut off the tip of its right thumb; the baby was then taken to the Government Stanley Hospital in Chennai where doctors performed surgery; Vellore Collector has ordered an inquiry into the incident

title: ¬†Work on subway near Green Circle in Vellore on fast track¬†
content: The new underpass will end a detour of at least one km by motorists and walkers, say officials; the facility will help decongest service lanes on both sides of the Chennai-Bengaluru Highway

title: Telangana CM joins Miss World crowning ceremony
content: During the announcement of the winner, Chief Minister Revanth Reddy was invited on stage to be part of the crowning ceremony

title: After a soaking May, IMD predicts slowdown in rain activity for a week
content: With no significant weather system over the Bay of Bengal, Chennai too may begin to experience a mild increase in maximum temperature from Sunday

title: Anbumani says he will steer PMK, calls his father ‚Äòfamily deity‚Äô
content: Speaking to the office-bearers from PMK strongholds such as Dharmapuri, Salem, Erode, Namakkal and Kallakurichi districts, Dr. Anbumani urged them to undertake a membership drive in the next three weeks and said that that he would soon take out a yatra across Tamil Nadu

title: Large crowd gathers to greet Chief Minister Stalin at roadshow in Madurai
content: He interacts with supporters during 20-km event, unveils life-size bronze statue of former Madurai Mayor S. Muthu; he will address the DMK‚Äôs general council meeting at Uthangudi today

title: Rajeev Krishna appointed acting DGP of Uttar Pradesh
content: Becomes fifth consecutive IPS officer to hold the post in an officiating capacity; SP chief Akhilesh Yadav questions move

title: KPTCL unveils GIS-based app to monitor underground cable works in real-time
content: According to officials, it is designed primarily for internal use, the Map View application showcases live updates of ongoing underground cable laying activities across Karnataka.

title: ‚ÄòSerious errors‚Äô in SSC evaluation a blot on the government, say student organisations
content: Blaming the government for its haste in releasing the results early, they demand that action against teachers be dropped and re-evaluation fee collected from students refunded

title: Delivery agents continue to brave Bengaluru‚Äôs monsoon without safety nets
content: Most agents still use personal scooters or rent electric vehicles which are unsafe, especially on flooded roads

title: Karnataka: State police chief asks personnel to refrain from random vehicle checks
content: Guidelines come in the wake of two recent incidents in Mandya and Davangere where random checks led to deaths

title: Bamboo and kendu power to the people
content: Those living in the forest villages of Odisha‚Äôs Kalahandi district, mostly tribal, are coming together to assert their rights over the forest provided to them by law, but often not claimed and sometimes denied.¬†Satyasundar Barik¬†finds that they are directly negotiating with traders to create a source of income without government go-betweens

title: KSRTC launches weekend package tour to Srirangapatna, Melukote from Bengaluru
content: The service began on May 31, and will be operational every Saturday and Sunday, according to officials.

title: No one trusts Bandi Sanjay‚Äôs comments on Congress: TPCC leader
content: Mr. Dayakar questioned the BJP‚Äôs credibility, pointing out that the party has failed to address the people‚Äôs concerns and has instead resorted to spreading false propaganda

title: Karnataka tightens COTPA rules; penalty for violations, legal age for purchasing tobacco products raised
content: The amended Act ‚Äî the Cigarettes and Other Tobacco Products (Prohibition of Advertisement and Regulation of Trade and Commerce, Production, Supply and Distribution) (Karnataka Amendment) Act, 2024 ‚Äî was published in the Karnataka Gazette on May 30

title: India engages U.S. in plans to ‚Äògrey list‚Äô Pakistan at FATF session
content: Foreign Secretary Misri concludes three-day visit, discusses trade and defence deals with his counterparts

title: As deaths in Karnataka touch four, Health Dept. issues advisory on COVID-19 surveillance, safety¬†
content: An 84-year-old in Bengaluru, a 70-year-old in Belagavi, and a 63-year-old in Mysuru, who also had several comorbid conditions and developed COVID, succumbed to the disease on May 17, 26, and 25 respectively.

title: Thailand‚Äôs Opal Suchata Chuangsri crowned Miss World 2025 in a dazzling grand finale in Hyderabad
content: The month-long celebration in Telangana featured historical tours, cultural showcases and a global platform for advocacy and empowerment

title: Government employees should not avail of Ladkhi Bahin scheme: Maharashtra Revenue Minister
content: The government would recover the money in such instances, and some departments had already commenced inquiries, Chandrashekhar Bawankule said

title: Hyderabad to adopt ‚Äòland pooling‚Äô and Local Area Development Planning to revolutionise HMDA functioning
content: LADP envisions intensive planning inside each grid, consisting of 250 to 300 acres of land, leading to more organised development; it will also help planners to earmark spaces for public utilities, parks, schools and hospitals, besides providing pedestrian infrastructure, HMDA Commissioner said

title: Centre notifies new age-based film certification categories under U/A rating
content: CBFC to certify films with ‚ÄòU/A 7+‚Äô, ‚ÄòU/A 13+‚Äô, and ‚ÄòU/A 16+‚Äô tags to promote age-appropriate viewing

title: Doping charge: Karnataka High Court sets aside four-year ban imposed on national level basketball player Shashank Rai
content: Court terms actions of anti-doping agencies ‚Äòa classic illustration of breach of sample integrity‚Äô and lacking in fair hearing

title: Indian Coast Guard evacuates heart attack-stricken captain from foreign vessel at sea
content: The Indian Coast Guard said it coordinated a ‚Äúlife saving medical evacuation operation‚Äù and evacuated a heart attack-stricken captain Bahamas flagged vessel

title: Nodal officers to monitor CSR-funded public schools; ‚Äòdiversion‚Äô of corporate funds flagged
content: Some corporates are allocating CSR funds to NGOs in other States and taking back 50% of it in cash, says Shivakumar

title: Study finds 17.4% prevalence of PCOS in Delhi‚Äôs college-going women
content: Polycystic Ovary Syndrome, the endocrinologic disorder affecting females in the reproductive age, characterised by menstrual dysfunction, infertility, hirsutism, acne, and obesity, is ‚Äòprevalent yet under-researched‚Äô, the study says

title: Karamana‚Äôs riverside walkway on path to becoming a full-fledged urban living space
content: 1.45-km walkway is undergoing a more ambitious makeover since March 2024 with the  construction of a cafeteria, toilet complex, football turf and cricket pitches

title: Name slips to promote messages against drug abuse in schools
content: Health Minister says the idea is to make children aware from a very young age that they should stay away from drugs

title: Case of disproportionate assets: VACB squad recovers several suspicious documents
